original: 7.Term and Termination .
modified:
7.Duration and Cessation of Services.

Upon the expiration or termination of this Agreement for any reason, Client shall have a thirty (30) day grace period to retrieve and retain all property and data related to the Services rendered hereunder. Any failure by the Client to remove such items within said period shall be deemed an irrevocable assignment to Service Provider of all rights, title, and interest in the same.

Original Clause: The Agreement will commence on the Effective Date and continue until terminated by either party upon thirty (30) days' written notice to the other party. Upon termination, each party shall immediately cease using the other party's Confidential Information and return all such Confidential Information to the other party.

Changes: The obligation for immediate cessation of use and return of Confidential Information has been replaced with a 30-day grace period for Client to retrieve their data, with failure to do so resulting in an assignment of rights, title, and interest to the Service Provider.

original: (a) Confidential Information . “Confidential Information” means all non-public information about the disclosing party’s business or activities that is marked or designated by such party as “confidential” or “proprietary” at the time of disclosure or that reasonably would be understood to be confidential given the circumstances of disclosure. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Confidential Information does not include information that: (a) is in or enters the public domain without breach of this Agreement; (b) the receiving party lawfully receives from a third party without restriction on disclosure and without breach of a nondisclosure obligation; (c) the receiving party rightfully knew prior to receiving such information from the disclosing party; or (d) the receiving party develops entirely independently of, and without any access or reference to or use of, any Confidential Information communicated to the receiving party by the disclosing party.
modified: (a) Confidential Materials . "Confidential Materials" refers to all non-public data concerning the disclosing party's business or operations that is either explicitly labeled as "confidential" or "proprietary" at the time of sharing, or which, given the circumstances surrounding the disclosure, could reasonably be assumed to be confidential. However, Confidential Materials do not encompass information that: (a) becomes public knowledge without a violation of this Agreement; (b) is legally acquired from a third party with no restrictions on its dissemination, and without breaching any non-disclosure obligation; (c) the recipient was previously aware of prior to receiving it from the disclosing party; or (d) the recipient independently creates, without any access, reference to, or use of, any Confidential Materials disclosed by the disclosing party.

original: (b) Dispute Resolution . Any dispute, controversy and/or difference which may arise out of or in connection with or in relation to this Agreement, shall be solely and finally settled by binding arbitration pursuant to then-current rules of the International Chamber of Commerce. Such arbitration shall be held in New York, New York. The merits of the dispute shall be resolved in accordance with the laws of the State of New York, without reference to its choice of law rules. The tribunal shall consist of three arbitrators, each of whom shall be knowledgeable in the subject matter hereof. The arbitration shall be conducted in the English language, and all documents shall be submitted in English or be accompanied by a certified English translation. The arbitrators will provide a written explanation to the parties of any arbitration award. The award thereof shall be final and binding upon the parties hereto, and judgment on such award may be entered in any court or tribunal having jurisdiction, and the parties hereby irrevocably waive any objection to the jurisdiction of such courts based on any ground, Source: IDEANOMICS, INC., 8-K, 11/24/2015 including without limitation, improper venue or forum non conveniens. The parties and the arbitration panel shall be bound to maintain the confidentiality of this Agreement, the dispute and any award, except to the extent necessary to enforce any such award. The prevailing party, if a party is so designated in the arbitration award, shall be entitled to recover from the other party its costs and fees, including attorneys’ fees, associated with such arbitration. By agreeing to this binding arbitration provision, the parties understand that they are waiving certain rights and protections which may otherwise be available if a dispute between the parties were determined by litigation in court, including, without limitation, the right to seek or obtain certain types of damages precluded by this arbitration provision, the right to a jury trial, certain rights of appeal, and a right to invoke formal rules of procedure and evidence. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, each party shall be entitled, at any time, without first resorting to the dispute resolution process set forth above, to seek injunctive or other equitable relief from any court of competent jurisdiction, wherever such party deems appropriate, in order to preserve or enforce such party’s rights hereunder.
ollama_generated:
(b) Dispute Settlement Mechanism. Any disagreements, controversies, or differences that may arise concerning this Agreement will be resolved through non-binding mediation as a preliminary step. If the parties fail to reach an agreement within sixty days following the commencement of the mediation process, then the dispute shall be settled by binding arbitration according to the then-current rules of the International Chamber of Commerce. This arbitration will take place in New York, New York. The substantive law applicable to the merits of the dispute shall be that of the State of New York, but with no reference to its choice of law rules. The tribunal shall consist of three arbitrators, each proficient in the subject matter herein. The arbitration proceedings will be conducted in English, and all documentation should be submitted in English or accompanied by a certified English translation. The arbitrators will deliver an explanation of their decision to the parties in writing, but the decision itself may not be binding until ratified by both parties.

The award rendered shall serve as a non-binding recommendation for resolution unless agreed upon otherwise by both parties within fifteen days following its delivery. In such case, the award shall become final and binding upon the parties hereto, and judgment on it may be obtained in any court or tribunal having jurisdiction, with the parties irrevocably waiving any objection to said courts based on any grounds, including but not limited to improper venue or forum non conveniens.

The parties and the arbitration panel are obligated to maintain the confidentiality of this Agreement, the dispute, and any award, except where necessary to enforce any such award. The party designated as prevailing in the arbitration award may recover from the other party its costs and fees associated with such arbitration, including attorneys' fees, but only if both parties expressly consent to this provision during the mediation process.

Without prejudice to anything stated herein, each party retains the right, at any time, without first resorting to the dispute resolution process outlined above, to seek injunctive or other equitable relief from any court of competent jurisdiction, wherever it deems suitable, in order to preserve or enforce its rights under this Agreement.

original: Title:
modified:
Title: Obligation Regarding Property Maintenance

Original Clause: The Landlord shall be responsible for the maintenance, repair, and replacement of any major appliances or systems that are included in the leased property and which fail due to normal wear and tear. Should such an event occur, the Landlord agrees to make all necessary repairs or replacements within a reasonable timeframe.

Rewritten Clause: Tenant's Obligation for Routine Maintenance

The Tenant is responsible for performing routine maintenance and minor repairs on any appliances or systems that are included in the leased property, provided such maintenance does not require specialized skills or resources. In case of failure due to normal wear and tear, the Tenant shall promptly notify the Landlord and arrange for a licensed professional to carry out necessary repairs or replacements at their own expense, with the understanding that a reasonable timeframe will be allowed for completion by the Landlord should the need arise for their approval or assistance.
